ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: those who denied and turned away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Who denied (the truth) and turned away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: who rejected the Truth, calling it falsehood and turned his back on it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: except the wicked ones who have rejected the (Truth) and have turned away from it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The one who denied and turned away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Who gives the lie (to the truth) and turns (his) back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: even he who cried lies, and turned away;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He who denieth and turneth away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: who denied [the truth], and turned away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: —he who impugns [God’s prophets] and turns his back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Who give the lie to Truth and turn their backs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He who denies and turns away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Who had denied and turned away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [92:16] he who denies, the Prophet, and turns away, from faith — this delimiting [of those who deserve to enter this fire] constitutes an interpretation of His saying, But He forgives other than that to whomever He will [Q. 4:48], which in turn suggests that what is meant is that entry [into the Fire] which will be everlasting.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He who denieth) Allah's divine Oneness; and it is also said: who falls short in obeying Allah (and turneth away) from faith; and it is also said: from repentance.
